channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Better late than never - Taranaki luge track to open this weekend
item.description: Taranaki’s first luge track will open its doors this Saturday – nearly 12 months after it was supposed to.
item.dc:creator: STEPHANIE OCKHUYSEN

item.title: Covid-19 live: Government to give 1pm update on the Delta situation
item.description: Deputy PM Grant Robertson and Director of Public Health Dr Caroline McElnay will have latest case numbers and an update on the Delta outbreak at 1pm.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19: Locations of interest in Delta outbreak – September 17
item.description: The newest locations of interest are in Cambridge, Ngatea, Bombay, Paeroa and Maramarua.
item.dc:creator: MELANIE EARLEY

item.title: Timaru homicide victims - twin girls aged 3 and sister of 7 - had recently arrived in New Zealand
item.description: The family are thought to have been in the town for less than a fortnight, after leaving MIQ facilities.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GUILDFORD RACHAEL COMER YASHAS SRINIVASA

item.title: Police allege shop attendant involved in armed holdup at petrol station
item.description: Police believe the apparent holdup at a Z service station was staged to look like an armed robbery, and a station employee was involved in the crime.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN GUILDFORD

item.title: Covid-19: Frustration and elation as Government says school holidays won't move
item.description: Principals are applauding the decision not to move the school holidays, while some parents are disappointed.
item.dc:creator: JOSEPHINE FRANKS

item.title: Human Rights Commission will stop taking complaints about use of te reo Māori
item.description: Te reo Māori is a right and using it is not discriminatory, Human Rights Commission's chief executive rules.
item.dc:creator: SAPEER MAYRON

item.title: New car industry pulls support for Clean Car Standard
item.description: Frustrated with the Government's 'appalling lack of understanding' the Motor Industry Association has withdrawn its support for the Clean Car Standard.
item.dc:creator: NILE BIJOUX

item.title: Farah Palmer Cup: Otago fitness-fanatic flankers fizzing for rugby resumption
item.description: Leah Miles and Grace Carroll became 'bubble buddies' during lockdown, and took their training to a whole new level.
item.dc:creator: AARON GOILE

item.title: Police gang operation uncovers a 'concerning trend' about guns
item.description: Police have made 865 arrests, and seized $5m in cash and 987 firearms, since Operation Tauwhiro began in February. But criminals are just getting craftier.
item.dc:creator: SOPHIE CORNISH

item.title: Confessions of a former Air New Zealand and Ansett flight attendant
item.description: Pippa Field recalls crewing Air NZ's first flight to Rarotonga and trying to get the Queen to sit down on a flight to Queenstown.
item.dc:creator: LORNA THORNBER

item.title: Ticking off the bucket list: 70-year-old cyclist to bike 600km in five days for cerebral palsy
item.description: Owen McCabe is about to realise a dream of pedalling from rural Waikato to Wellington, and is raising money for cerebral palsy at the same time.
item.dc:creator: CHLOE BLOMMERDE

item.title: Covid-19: Education Minister Chris Hipkins says school holidays won't be moved in Auckland
item.description: Auckland students will go on holiday at the same time as the rest of New Zealand, despite spending weeks in lockdown.
item.dc:creator: BRIDIE WITTON

item.title: Kea Kids News: An American poi star on TikTok is getting a lot of love from Kiwi fans
item.description: Jared Aldrich is a master with poi, and he's turned his talents into must-watch TikToks. He's never been to Aotearoa but his Kiwi fan base would give him a warm welcome.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Plotting our course through the strong winds of change
item.description: OPINION: An arms-length view of the three waters reforms, and a reminder of paddock-selection help for farmers.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Quiz: Take the three strikes trivia test for September 17, 2021
item.description: You get three chances to correctly rank the answers in today's question for September 17, 2021.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW SLAUGHTER

item.title: Kea Kids News: Teen poet Kyllah speaks from the heart and it's won her serious attention
item.description: Auckland schoolgirl and rising star poet Kyllah Iosua scooped a major prize at the E Te Whānau poetry competition, winning the 18 and under section — on her 12th birthday.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Missing family: Surf lifesavers searching in Marokopa pass items on to police
item.description: “Our role today is to look in every nook and cranny and get into the caves and rule out there is no evidence of them being there," Surf Lifesaving NZ's Allan Mundy said.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: How the All Blacks can return to No 1 in the world on Saturday night in Brisbane
item.description: If Rugby Championship results play out in a similar way to last weekend, the men in black will be back atop the rankings for the first time in two years.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Underwear in costly twist as mystery clothing flusher strikes
item.description: Four tops and five pairs of underpants flushed down the toilet since the start of August have caused eight blockages of pump stations in Māpua, near Nelson.
item.dc:creator: CHERIE SIVIGNON
